reasoning: Rare autosomal dominant disorder of PTH resistance. Estimated 1 in 20,000-30,000 births globally. Incidence ~1.8 per 100k based on genetic surveys. Limited epidemiological data in literature.
source: Albright F. (1942). A syndrome characterized by osteitis fibrosa disseminata and areas of pigmentation and endocrine dysfunction with precocious puberty in females. N Engl J Med. 216:727-746
